------=_NextPart_001_04F8_01C300A6.176DAA60
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Gordon,

Please find attached the performance report on the SEDA aSocket NI=
O layer. Look for the last section in the document "SEDA NIO Socket Framewo=
rk" and the "Summary" section is also updated with the results. An excel sh=
eet with the readings and the graph is also attached for reference.

We wou=
ld like to have a brief chat with you on Tuesday 8:30 pm PST ( Monday is a =
holiday for us on the eve of Tamil new year ) about SEDA socket layer and g=
enerally about the various tasks and other proceedings.

JAnt Build Status =
:

- The proposed directory structure is not yet created since we are still=
 in the Anecdote prototyping stage and we do not have any complete package =
to checkin. I have modified the ant script a bit to suit the present Anecdo=
te structure and activated a cronjob over it. I have also added you and Ray=
mie to the notification mail-ids list so that you would also get the nightl=
y build mails. You could get the nightly build from the location "/home/use=
rs/w/wc/wcr-team/NightlyBuilds" as stated in the mail on shell.sourceforge.=
net. You could use your own logins and do SFTP to access the NightlyBuilds =
directory. It has read permissions for all.

- I am not sure why the stata =
labs libraries ( st.ata.* packages) have been checked in as a separate CVS =
module. Are we planning to upgrade/modify those sources and maintain oursel=
ves. If not, we could just have the built classes in a jar in CVS lib direc=
tory as we had done for other third party libraries. Otherwise, if we want =
to maintain it, then would we require that to be a separate CVS module ? I =
think it would be better if we have one CVS root module under which everyth=
ing is put in. Probably, in such cases, we can have a "thiryPartySrc" direc=
tory to maintain such sources within our main module "OpenWebCrawler" itsel=
f.

Thanks,
Reddy


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: G.B.Reddy 
  To=
: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, April 11, 2003 12:46 AM
=
  Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Status !!


  Gordon,

  As you say, the a=
SocketInputStream is needed only if the client stage is multithreaded. But =
the oceanstore "HttpClient" stage is internally using it to do sequencing w=
hich is unnecessary since anyway the "HttpClient" class implements SingleTh=
readedEventHandlerIF. I have removed these overheads to do my performance t=
esting.

  After starting to test the SEDA socket performance, I ran into t=
hree problems in the SEDA's socket framework.

  - Newly discovered bug : T=
he seda internals throw ConcurrentModification exceptions when iterating th=
rough the selector's registered keys. This exceptions is highly reproducibl=
e when more number of concurrent downloads happen. Synchronization has not =
been taken care when the ReadEventHandler tries to deregister the socket fr=
om the selector of the WriteEventHandler. ( As you would know, there are th=
ree stages ReadStage, WriteStage and ListenStage in the seda socket framewo=
rk. Each has its own java Selector instance and they wait on its select cal=
l. The ReadStage is the one that determines that a connection is terminated=
. When this happens, it directly tries to make a deregister call on the Wri=
teStage's selector on this socket object. So, easily concurrent mod excepti=
ons are thrown when my downloader stage is pumping requests and making new =
connections). I shall raise this bug to the author and I am proceeding with=
 my fix on it. Because of this unsynchronized communication, a lot of Cance=
lledKeyExceptions are also thrown in the internals.

  - A documented bug :=
 ConcurrentModification exceptions when iterating through the selector's se=
lectedKeys. This is also due to no synchronization. Multiple threads are al=
lowed by the seda internals to do select calls on a single selector. (Look =
for the docs in seda.sandStorm.lib.aSocket.nio.NIOSelectSource.doPoll metho=
d). I will have to look for doing some minimal synchronization as stated in=
 there.

  - There has been other rare NullPointerExceptions and IllegalArg=
umentException in some places. I will have to look into their implications.=


  I will fix the last two problems and get the performance measurements t=
omorrow.

  Thanks,
  Reddy

    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Go=
rdon Mohr 
    To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Wednesday, Ap=
ril 09, 2003 12:17 AM
    Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Status !!


    Th=
anks for the update!

    The Ocenstore libhttp package is known to be very=
 rough; really just a
    placeholder or starting point for what we'd need.=
 (Note that there's
    also an alternative 'libhttp2' package in OceanStor=
e, but it seemed both
    unused in their other code and more elaborate, so=
 I haven't tried
    to use it yet.)

    The TCP response ordering capabil=
ities to aSocketInputStream only seem
    necessary if you have multiple th=
reads reading from the same socket -- which
    I think can, and probably s=
hould, be avoided.

    I'm looking forward to seeing the test results.

  =
  I like the BuildDesign proposal; please move forward with creating
    th=
at structure for a new module on the sourceforge CVS. However,
    please u=
se the module name of "ArchiveOpenCrawler" (instead of
    "Web-crawler").
=

    Thanks!

    - Gordon

    ----- Original Message -----
    From: G.B.=
Reddy
    To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
    Sent: Tuesday, April 08, =
2003 11:04 AM
    Subject: [archive-crawler] Status !!


    Gordon,

    I=
 am presently working on the SEDA socket overhead determination work. I wil=
l get the results in the next two days. Some initial
    insights into it a=
re
    - Oceanstore manages both Tx and Rx in a single stage.
    - It just=
 holds the responses in memory only. It does not write into tmp files if th=
ey are huge.
    - TCP response reordering is done by using the seda.sandSt=
orm.lib.aSocket.aSocketInputStream class which reorders packets according
 =
   to the ATcpInPacket sequence number.

    The test that will be done :
 =
   - Port the downloader code ( which we had written earlier during the jav=
a nio performance tests ) to SEDA framework and use the
    OceanStore libr=
ary for HTTP fetching. The same tests that we did for the downloader will b=
e repeated in this oceanstore setup. We
    are removing some oceanstore co=
de to make it similar. The result of this test would tell us the percentage=
 of overhead imposed by
    the SEDA framework.


    We are also done with=
 the JAnt packaging scripts. It uses the present CVS structure itself. I sh=
all create the proposed CVS
    structure after you approve it. Today we ha=
ve put the cronjob for testing the web hosting part of nightly builds. We s=
hall enable it
    for all tomorrow. As of now, only the last nightly build=
 will be available for download. More changes need to be made for hosting
 =
   every nightly build of a week.

    Thanks,
    Reddy

    Yahoo! Groups=
 Sponsor
    ADVERTISEMENT

email to:
    archive-crawler-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com



    Your use o=
f Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.



    To unsubs=
cribe from this group, send an email to:
    archive-crawler-unsubscribe@ya=
hoogroups.com



    Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Ter=
ms of Service.

              ADVERTISEMEN=
T
             
       
       

  To unsubscribe from this group, send an =
email to:
  archive-crawler-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com



  Your use of Ya=
hoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.
